Updated November     pm





Greenville Police Department Chief Mark Holtzman spoke at a press conference on Saturday about the shots fired at the AMC movie theater PERIOD

The Greenville Police Department responded to a report of shots fired at the AMC movie theater on  E PERIOD Fire Tower Road just before midnight yesterday PERIOD

According to a press release witnesses reported an altercation inside the movie theater between several people that lead to shots being fired PERIOD GPD said there were no injuries and the incident appears to be isolated PERIOD

During a press conference today GPD Chief Mark Holtzman said officers arrived at the scene in less than two minutes and the movie theater was evacuated as a precaution PERIOD

Initial officers responded to the scene and we treated this as an active shooter from the beginning Holtzman said PERIOD The response was a team effort with help from the East Carolina University Police Department and the Sheriffs Department PERIOD

We detained three people that had ran out of the theater and over to the Walmart location Holtzman said PERIOD 

Holtzman said any moviegoers who did not speak to the police during the initial incident are encouraged to reach out to GPD PERIOD









The press conference for the answers for the shooting on the theater that what was the matter for that while all are busy to watching the movie PERIOD In that theater members and partners of assignment man writing service was shocked when the firing has been started and all ran away to outside PERIOD
